Question

You are given an urn with 100 balls (50 black and 50 white). You pick balls from urn one by one without replacements until all the balls are out. A black followed by a white or a white followed by a black is "a colour change". Calculate the expected number of colour-changes if the balls are being picked randomly from the urn.

Hint

Linearity of expectation

Answer

50

Solution

Each time we draw, there could be a possible color-switch, except the first time we draw, hence 99 possible switches.

Let XiX_iXi​ be a random variable taking value 1 if ithi_{th}ith​ position has a colour change and zero otherwise, note that iii goes from 111 to 999999.

Total number of changes, S=X1+X2+...+X99=∑i=199XiS = X_1 + X_2 + ... + X_{99} = \sum_{i=1}^{99} X_iS=X1​+X2​+...+X99​=∑i=199​Xi​

The expected number of color changes is denoted by the sum of these variables, i.e E[S]=E[X1+X2+...+X99]E[S] = E[X_1 + X_2 + ... + X_{99}]E[S]=E[X1​+X2​+...+X99​]

Linearity of expectation states that the expected value of the sum of random variables is equal to the sum of their individual expected values.

Hence the answer is E[S]=E[X1]+E[X2]+...+E[X99]E[S] = E[X_1] + E[X_2] + ... + E[X_{99}]E[S]=E[X1​]+E[X2​]+...+E[X99​]

Note that each XiX_iXi​ is identical, and the expected value is equal for each iii, i.e, E(Xk)=E(X1)E(X_k) = E(X_1) E(Xk​)=E(X1​)

Hence E[S]=E[X1]+...+E[Xn]=∑i=199E[X1]=99∗E[X1]E[S] = E[X_1] + ... + E[X_n] = \sum_{i=1}^{99} E[X_1] = 99 * E[X_1] E[S]=E[X1​]+...+E[Xn​]=∑i=199​E[X1​]=99∗E[X1​]

Also, we can calculate the expected value, E[X1]=1∗P(X1=1)+0∗P(X1=0)=P(X1=1)E[X_1] = 1 * P(X_1 = 1) + 0 * P(X_1 = 0) = P(X_1 =1) E[X1​]=1∗P(X1​=1)+0∗P(X1​=0)=P(X1​=1)

Probability of any given color change is (either first is R second is B, or first is B and second is R) =P(X1=1)=50100∗5099+50100∗5099=50/99= P(X_1 = 1)= \dfrac{50}{100}*\dfrac{50}{99} + \dfrac{50}{100}*\dfrac{50}{99} = 50/99=P(X1​=1)=10050​∗9950​+10050​∗9950​=50/99

Finally, the answer is E[S]=∑i=199E[Xi]=99∗E[X1]=99∗50/99=50 E[S] = \sum_{i=1}^{99} E[X_i] = 99 * E[X_1] = 99 * 50/99 = 50E[S]=∑i=199​E[Xi​]=99∗E[X1​]=99∗50/99=50

Note: XiX_iXi​'s are not independent, but since all the balls are drawn randomly, the probability-distribution is identical for each draw. For instance, if you are given no information about the previous colors, and I ask 'what is the probability that 5th draw has a color change?', your answer will not depend on '5', instead the answer will be same for any index.
